alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 30 at 10:02AM CST until January 31 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 AM MST /9 AM CST/ TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Colorado, northwest and west central Kansas and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ this afternoon to 8 AM MST /9 AM CST/ Tuesday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The Wind Chill Advisory for Monday morning has expired, some locations across Yuma, Cheyenne County Kansas and Dundy counties may see a brief period of 15 below wind chills as clouds have cleared but temperatures should warm.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
